item.title: PornHub Among Adult Sites Probed by EU on Child Safety Fears
item.description: The European Union has started a probe into adult video platforms PornHub, Stripchat, XNXX and XVideos based on concerns over child protection.
item.dc:creator: Gian Volpicelli

media:content.media:description: smartphones

item.title: Turkish Fintech Firm Papara Seized in Illegal Gambling Probe
item.description: Turkish authorities seized electronic payments firm Papara Elektronik Para AS on charges that the company facilitated illegal gambling, state-run Anadolu Agency reported.
item.dc:creator: Taylan Bilgic

media:content.media:description: Turkish Police officers. Photographer: Adem Altan/Getty Images

item.title: Qualcomm Releases Study Showing That Its Modems Beat Apple’s C1
item.description: A study commissioned by Qualcomm Inc. found that its modem chips worked better than a rival component developed by Apple Inc., especially for cellular customers in dense urban areas.
item.dc:creator: Ian King

media:content.media:description: Apple’s 16e is its first model to use a new in-house modem.

item.title: Meta Rolls Out WhatsApp for iPad in Belated Concession to Tablet Users
item.description: Meta Platforms Inc.’s WhatsApp released an iPad-specific version of its popular messaging app, belatedly offering a larger-format experience to users with Apple Inc. tablets.
item.dc:creator: Chris Welch

media:content.media:description: WhatsApp for iPad

item.title: Salesforce Agrees to Buy Informatica in Deal Worth $8 Billion
item.description: Salesforce Inc. has agreed to buy Informatica Inc. for about $8 billion, sealing the deal on a software firm that had seen its shares plunge by as much as 59% since the companies’ first talks failed last year.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould, Liana Baker, Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: Attendees stand in the lobby area of the the Salesforce Tower in San Francisco, California, U.S., on Tuesday, May 22, 2018. The building, the tallest office tower west of the Mississippi river, opened with a ceremony crowded with local officials on Tuesday, representing the indelible mark San Francisco's largest private employer has made on the city. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: Temu Operator PDD Tumbles as Trade War Hits Sales, Profit
item.description: Shares of Temu owner PDD Holdings Inc. plunged in US trading after its quarterly sales and profit missed estimates, underscoring how trade tensions between Beijing and Washington are taking a toll on its business.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding

media:content.media:description: The PDD Holdings Inc. website. Photographer: Lam Yik/Bloomberg

item.title: Venture Capitalist Palihapitiya Buys Stake in Arizona Property for Data-Center Bet
item.description: Venture capitalist Chamath Palihapitiya is investing in an Arizona land deal, betting that the site could be used for data centers given its potential access to 1,500 megawatts of power.
item.dc:creator: John Gittelsohn

media:content.media:description: Anita Verma-Lallian

item.title: Top Africa Clothes Retailer Pepkor Sees Rise in Smartphone Sales
item.description: Pepkor Holdings Ltd. has increased its lead as South Africa’s biggest seller of mobile phones using prepaid wireless plans, with demand for access to online financial services spurring appetite.
item.dc:creator: Janice Kew

media:content.media:description: Smartphones for sale in Pretoria, South Africa. Photographer: Waldo Swiegers/Bloomberg

item.title: Apple Shares Face More Pain as Trump’s Tariff Threat Looms
item.description: Apple Inc. shares are coming off their longest selloff in more than three years, as escalating attacks from the White House threaten to further erode the company’s profit outlook, suggesting the stock’s struggles this year are far from over.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Vlastelica, Carmen Reinicke

media:content.media:description: iPhone 16 on sale at Apple's Fifth Avenue store in New York. Photographer: Victor J. Blue/Bloomberg

item.title: Kuaishou Sees Higher Spending on AI Development Denting Margins
item.description: Chinese social platform Kuaishou Technology expects to spend more on artificial intelligence development as it tries to dispel concerns about lackluster monetization of its latest AI tool.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Yeo

media:content.media:description: Kuaishou branding.

item.title: ABB Is Said to Pick BofA, UBS for Potential Robotics Unit Deal
item.description: ABB Ltd. has selected Bank of America Corp. and UBS Group AG to arrange a potential deal for its robotics unit, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Eyk Henning, Allegra Catelli, Dinesh Nair

media:content.media:description: An ABB industrial robot.

item.title: Russia’s Richest Man Gains Stake in Tech Giant Yandex
item.description: Billionaire Vladimir Potanin acquired a stake in Yandex, Russia’s leading tech company, following the expiration of a lock-up period related to last year’s sale of the company’s local business by its Dutch-registered founder.
item.dc:creator: Yuliya Fedorinova, Alexander Sazonov

media:content.media:description: Vladimir Potanin Photographer: Chris J. Ratcliffe/Bloomberg

item.title: Alibaba Weighs Options to Reduce Stake in ZTO Express
item.description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. is considering options to pare down its minority stake in express delivery firm ZTO Express (Cayman) Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Pei Li, Dong Cao, Julia Fioretti

media:content.media:description: Alibaba headquarters in Hangzhou, China.

item.title: Xiaomi Sales Beat Estimates on EV, Smartphone Growth
item.description: Xiaomi Corp. reported better-than-expected revenue in the March quarter as it moves to aggressively expand its presence in China’s EV market and grow its core smartphone business.
item.dc:creator: John Liu, Jessica Sui

item.title: Salesforce Nears $25-Per-Share Deal for Informatica
item.description: Salesforce Inc. is in advanced talks to acquire Informatica Inc. for about $8 billion including debt, according to a person familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould

media:content.media:description: Salesforce headquarters in San Francisco, California. Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: What Is Ransomware, and How Did It Get So Big?
item.description: In 2021, following a cyberattack that crippled fuel supplies along the US East Coast, then President Joe Biden vowed to make ransomware a national security priority. Executive orders were passed, summits were convened and indictments and sanctions were issued to try to curb the crimes. Four years later, ransomware remains a persistent thorn for businesses and organizations across the world. Retailers, manufacturers, hospitals and schools are among those impacted so far in 2025. The ransomware sc
item.dc:creator: Andrew Martin, Sana Pashankar

media:content.media:description: M&S saw a £300 million hit from a cyberattack.

item.title: Singapore's AI Push Charts Path Toward Localized Models
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Saritha Rai returns from a week in Singapore with word of the latest AI developments in the region.
item.dc:creator: Saritha Rai

media:content.media:description: Office workers during lunch hour at Tanjong Pagar in the central business district of Singapore.

item.title: Silicon Data Creates First-of-Its-Kind Index for AI Chips
item.description: Silicon Data, a market-intelligence firm that focuses on the cost of graphics processing units, created what it says is the first daily index to track the specialized chips vital to powering artificial intelligence.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Doherty

item.title: Tencent Increases Korea Music Exposure Ahead of China K-Pop Move
item.description: Tencent Holdings Ltd. is snapping up a nearly 10% stake in SM Entertainment Co. Ltd valued at about $180 million, marking a rare Chinese investment into a South Korean company in recent years.
item.dc:creator: Shinhye Kang, Sohee Kim

media:content.media:description: K-pop group Aespa. Photographer: Etienne Laurent/AFP/Getty Images

item.title: Thiel Fund Leads $49 Million Investment in Bulgarian Space Firm
item.description: Peter Thiel’s Founders Fund is adding to its space portfolio by leading a €43 million ($49 million) investment in EnduroSat, a Bulgarian manufacturer of satellites.
item.dc:creator: Edward Ludlow

media:content.media:description: Peter Thiel in Sun Valley, Idaho in July 2023.

item.title: Samsung Is Said in Talks to Invest in California-Based Exo
item.description: Samsung Electronics Co.’s investment arm is among a group of firms seeking to invest in US health-care software and device company Exo Imaging Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Manuel Baigorri

media:content.media:description: A man walks past the Samsung logo displayed on a glass door at the company's Seocho building in Seoul on April 30, 2024. Samsung Electronics said on April 30 that its first-quarter operating profits had risen nearly tenfold year-on-year -- a 931.8 percent increase -- amid recovering chip prices and growing demand. (Photo by Jung Yeon-je / AFP) (Photo by JUNG YEON-JE/AFP via Getty Images) Photographer: JUNG YEON-JE/AFP

item.title: Canada’s BDC Makes ‘Buy Canadian’ Pitch to Venture Capitalists
item.description: The Canadian government’s business financing arm is urging the country’s investors to deploy more cash into startups and growth companies that need it, as the trade war with the US casts a chilling effect on Canada’s venture capital market.
item.dc:creator: Mathieu Dion

media:content.media:description: Buildings in downtown Montreal, Quebec, Canada, on Saturday, April 8, 2023. The Bloomberg Nanos Canadian Confidence Index, which is based on calling 250 Canadians for their views on personal finances, job security and their outlook for both the economy and real estate prices, is little changed at 48.83 from 48.77 the prior week.

item.title: Meituan, JD.com’s Food Delivery War Worsens $100 Billion Rout
item.description: Shares of Meituan and JD.com have lost a combined $100 billion in market value since late last year, highlighting the fallout of a costly battle to win a bigger slice of the Chinese food delivery business.
item.dc:creator: Charlotte Yang

item.title: HKBN’s CEO Says China Mobile Takeover Offer Undervalues Firm
item.description: China Mobile Ltd.’s takeover offer for HKBN Ltd. undervalues the company, according to the Hong Kong broadband provider’s top executive.
item.dc:creator: Pei Li, Dong Cao

media:content.media:description: Signage for HKBN Ltd. in Hong Kong.

item.title: Meituan Warns Local Rivalry, Global Push to Hurt Profits
item.description: Meituan warned its profitability may suffer as the Chinese food delivery leader faces intensifying competition at home and is aggressively expanding into new markets.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding

media:content.media:description: Food delivery couriers for Meituan in Shanghai, China. Photographer: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg

item.title: ALS to Raise Up to A$390 Million to Grow Laboratory Network
item.description: Australia’s ALS Ltd. is seeking to raise up to A$390 million ($253 million) as the testing services company looks to expand its laboratory network.
item.dc:creator: Carmeli Argana

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg Loves MAGA Now. Will MAGA Ever Love Him Back?
item.description: Meta’s CEO has done everything he can to win over Trump, and it’s not clear how much he has to show for it.
item.dc:creator: Riley Griffin, Kurt Wagner

media:content.media:description: Mark Zuckerberg says recent changes to Meta’s content policies reflect an authentic representation of his personal views.

item.title: US Prosecutors Sought Builder.ai Data After Sales Overstated
item.description: US prosecutors demanded that Builder.ai hand over financial statements and other documents, signaling that the artificial intelligence company was facing legal scrutiny in the weeks before it went bust.
item.dc:creator: Yazhou Sun

media:content.media:description: Sachin Dev Duggal

item.title: EU Tells Shein to Tackle Consumer Law Breaches or Face Fines
item.description: Shein Group Ltd., the Singapore-based e-commerce firm, was warned by European Union regulators it could face fines unless it clamps down on consumer protection violations on its platform.
item.dc:creator: Gian Volpicelli

media:content.media:description: A Shein pop-up store in Dublin, Ireland. Photographer: Paulo Nunes dos Santos/Bloomberg

item.title: ChatGPT’s Improved Memory Points Toward a More Personal AI
item.description: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Austin Carr reports on the improvements recently announced to the major consumer chatbots that have made it easier for them to know more about their users.
item.dc:creator: Austin Carr

media:content.media:description: The ChatGPT artificial intelligence mobile phone app.
